entry.title: Modifying Headers In HTTP(s) Requests In UI Automation Testing
entry.summary: To be able to modify headers in a testing environment is a great thing to have. It allows control over your application as one can bypass authentication, set cookies, and so on. In this article, Nafees Nehar explores some methods which allow modification of headers in an automation testing setup.

entry.title: Free Christmas Icon Sets And Vector Elements
entry.summary: Everybody loves a nice freebie, right? To get you in the mood for the upcoming holidays, we collected some winter- and holiday-themed icon sets and vector elements that you can use in your projects for free. Enjoy!

entry.title: Designing Better Links For Websites And Emails: A Guideline
entry.summary: There are so many websites out there that have not considered the overall usability of their visually impaired users. When it comes to designing better links and sending better emails, Slava Shestopalov has a few tips on how to improve your website‚Äôs experience while accessibility in mind.

entry.title: Advent Calendars For Web Designers And Developers (December 2021 Edition)
entry.summary: Are you ready for the countdown to Christmas? From [festive](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2016/12/freebie-christmas-advent-icon-set-25-icons-ai-eps-svg-png-pdf/) [icon](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2015/12/freebie-christmas-icons-illustrations/) [sets](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2014/11/freebie-christmas-icon-set-ai-psd-eps-pdf-svg-png/) to advent calendars that are bound to sweeten your days with a delightful little surprise each morning, we‚Äôve decided to join in on this lovely annual tradition and bring it all to one place. So prepare yourself a nice cup of coffee and get cozy ‚Äî there‚Äôs always something new to learn and discover!

entry.title: How To Protect Your API Key In Production With Next.js API Route
entry.summary: There‚Äôs a great challenge that comes with building Jamstack applications on the web. In this article, Caleb Olojo explains how you can use Next.js to bootstrap your app safely.

entry.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 44 With Chris Ferdinandi: Is The Web Dead?
entry.summary: In this episode, we‚Äôre asking if changes to best practises over the last year have negatively impacted the web. Is it all downhill from here? Drew McLellan talks to expert Chris Ferdinandi to find out.

entry.title: It‚Äôs That Time Of The Year (December 2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)
entry.summary: Let‚Äôs welcome December with some new wallpapers! Designed by artists and designers from across the globe, they are available with and without a calendar for the month. Enjoy!

entry.title: 3D CSS Flippy Snaps With React And GreenSock
entry.summary: One of Jhey‚Äôs main mantras is to make learning fun. In this article, he shows you ways to level up your skills by bringing your ideas to life, and not forgetting that [you can be playful with code](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/11/playfulness-code-supercharge-fun-learning/). entry.title: How To Maintain A Large Next.js Application
entry.summary: In this article, Nirmalya discusses some of the complex problems that he faced while building and maintaining large Next.js applications. He always explains how these problems can be solved by using various tools.

entry.title: A Showcase Of Lovely Little Websites
entry.summary: Instead of spending your coffee break scrolling through your social feeds, how about a lovely little website instead? We came across some fantastic ones that are just too good not to be shared. But be warned, your break might take a bit longer than intended.

entry.title: Adding A Dyslexia-Friendly Mode To A Website
entry.summary: With a little CSS, we can adapt our web designs to be more accommodating for people with dyslexia. In this article, we‚Äôll explore those techniques by adding a dyslexia-friendly mode to an existing design.

entry.title: Smashing Workshops: Winter 2021
entry.summary: What‚Äôs the state of CSS, Vue.js and Next.js? What are new, smart interface design patterns we could use? Let‚Äôs figure it out. With our [online workshops on UX, front-end and design](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops).

entry.title: Improving The Performance Of Wix Websites (Case Study)
entry.summary: Implementing a performance culture is very important. In this article, Dan Shappir shares which actions and processes the Wix team put in place in order to achieve dramatic improvements in the performance of websites built and hosted on their platform.
